summary: The 'Fast-Track Logistics for Acquiring Supplies in a Hurry Act of 2025' (FLASH Act of 2025) amends the Public Health Service Act. It grants the Biomedical Advanced Research and Development Authority (BARDA) increased authority to award follow-on production contracts, procure supplies for experimental testing, and acquire innovative commercial products and services. The bill aims to streamline the acquisition process for essential supplies related to national public health and health security, including purchases for testing, manufacturing, and protective equipment. Notably, it also outlines procedures for noncompetitive procurement and requires congressional notification for large contracts.
